greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of colored integer partitions of n such that all colors from a k-set are used and parts differ by size or by color; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: For fixed k > 0, T(n,k) ~ exp(Pi*sqrt(k*n/3)) * k^(1/4) / (3^(1/4) * 2^((k+3)/2) * n^(3/4)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 16 2019
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
formula: G.f. of column k: (-1 + Product_{j>=1} (1 + x^j))^k. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 29 2021
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0, add((t->
b(t, min(t, i-1), k)*binomial(k, j))(n-i*j), j=0..min(k, n/i))))
T:= (n, k)-> add(b(n$2, k-i)*(-1)^i*binomial(k, i), i=0..k):
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 31 2021
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Sum[Function[t,    b[t, Min[t, i - 1], k]*Binomial[k, j]][n - i*j], {j, 0, Min[k, n/i]}]]];
T[n_, k_] := Sum[b[n, n, k - i]*(-1)^i*Binomial[k, i], {i, 0, k}];
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 06 2019, from Maple *)
xref: Main diagonal and lower diagonals give: A000012, A001477, A000096.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 29 2019
